column5: And then, you could also try some after-shave...

Q-Tips up yer nostrils works!  Seriously though, they do smell strongly, kinda put me off eating them the first time i caught some..but they taste so good i dont mind the smell anymore, i wash my hands with dish soap, and my wife is used to it....lol

Just finished fishing/cleaning/eating/showering washed with orange glow/palm aloive .. what takes away the witie smell?  stinky mgee here  .. help would be nice.. going to the basement for a bottle of bleach
Are you saying that you had 'seemingly congress' with a skunk, or that you were fishing and didn't catch anything, or that not catching anything is typical (like me)?  Jes' wonderin'.
im saying i caught a wack of witie with 3 guys spent 2 hours cleaning them  i stinklike white  cant wash away that dirty smell . i may have to sleep on the couch...lol
Rub your hands on the stainless steel on your sink. Wash your hands with lemon juice. Vinegar works ok too.  I like the smell of whities......kinda like fresh cucumbers.......or smelts  Sinker
Good suggestions....toothpaste works as well!
I second toothpaste.
Just wash you hands with COLD water and salt. Warm/hot water opens the pores in your skin so use COLD water.
What's wrong with smelling like fish?
This won't help now, but, NEXT time, just wear some latex.  Gloves.  When you're cleaning the fish.
Question on the toothpaste, is that before or after you use it
I don't really think it matters... do you Chief?
go catch some lakers....change up that stink!  RR
I second the stainless steel.  just rub your hands on the faucet or sink.  Another fav when Im camping is the grab a bunch of pine needles and rub them through my hands to mask/get rid of the smell.
Wash your hands with a blob of ketchup...

lol  it was a combonation  was out with 3 friends cleaned 6 whitfish 4 trout ..Im the only one who can clean them without geting bones.  Thx for all the help guys  the smell is gone  at least for now  and I think its always better to smell like  a fish than a skunk....
BUY THE HAND SANITIZER FROM SHOPPERS DRUGMART, IT'S A LITTLE PAINFUL IF YOU HAVE ANY CUTS ON YOUR HANDS BUT IT WORKS GREAT,THE COST IS ABOUT $6
Whitefish smell is the best.

i wouldnt worry about it too much. That's the smell of success. As for your buddies, teach them to Fillet. I've tought 1 or too i fish with too fillet, after doing a bunch of fish myself. Teaching to fillet properly is better quicker then doing it yourself al the time lol  Still its good to hear you were into the fish.  -R-
whitefish smell good, why would you wanna get rid of that smell.. its like a cologne
Lemon juice works.  Joey
rubbing alcohol
I'm with Beans and anyone else... KETCHUP ALL THE WAY....
I learned that from you Shelley...LOL
Im now sure how to wash it away........ but i usually wash it down with a few coors light..... not sure if that helps!
I second the stainless steel thing....thats why fishing stores sell stainless steel soap bars. Lemon juice sounds good too. Top it off with some vinegar to help with smell.
